title: About cooperation
text:
I’m eager to collaborate on research projects within my areas of expertise, which encompass political science, statistical methodology, and survey data. If you have any proposals or opportunities for collaboration, please feel free to reach out to me via email. I’m always open to discussing potential projects and partnerships.
If you’d like to get in touch, feel free to email me.

title: Ilya Fominykh
text:
MS in Statistics and Methodology

Hello! I am a data analyst with 5+ years of experience in quantitative research and over a year in business analytics. My expertise includes working with complex sources—sales data, search data, digital traces, and surveys—to generate actionable business insights and help manage the operations. Advanced statistical modeling, survey methodology, and causal inference are among my key skills. Proficient in R, Python, SQL, and Microsoft Fabric, I design and develop near-real-time dashboards, transforming raw data into clear, stakeholder-ready reports. I am committed to connecting data and business strategy to drive commercial success.
Welcome to my portfolio, where you can explore my applied and academic research.
 
  
   
  
    
     Rotterdam, The Netherlands

title: My Projects
text:
COMPARING BAYESIAN APPROACHES TO EXPLORATORY FACTOR ANALYSIS | Research Project  | 2023-ongoing
Contributed to a comparative study of R packages for Bayesian exploratory factor analysis (EFA), aiming to evaluate their performance and underlying assumptions. The project supports the development of a robust framework for future simulation-based validation of BEFA methods. Co-authoring a research paper based on the study’s findings.
COMBINING DIGITAL TRACE DATA AND SURVEY DATA FOR PARTICIPATION PREDICTION | Thesis Project | 2023-2024
Investigated integration of digital trace and survey data, specifically addressing bias from selective participation. Explored sources of bias and analyzed data enrichment techniques that allow to enhance accuracy and inclusiveness of demographic groups typically underrepresented in survey research. More about the findings is available here.

title: My Projects
text:
Political Science
YOUTH INDOCTRINATION: WILL IT ACHIEVE LOYALTY OR HATRED? | Research Project  | 2023 - 2025
This project investigates the effects of state-driven propaganda in schools on youth political attitudes and values. Using a quasi-experimental design, We examine how exposure to soft propaganda influences political trust, civic engagement, and nationalist sentiments among adolescents. More can be found here.
TECHNOLOGICAL ILLIBERALISM: ELECTORAL CONSEQUENCES | Research Project  | 2023 - 2024
Analyzed how digital infrastructure and emergency-era policies affect electoral outcomes in authoritarian contexts, using data on online voting in Russia. Co-authored a working paper on youth political attitudes and state-led digital securitization, available here.
REPLICATION STUDY OF INEQUALITY TRAP BY ERIK USLANER | Research Project  | 2021 - 2022
Replicated Uslaner’s findings on the links between inequality, corruption, and generalized trust using recent waves of the World Values Survey and European Social Survey. Results matched the original study. Project results are available here.
STRATEGIES OF PARLIAMENTARY PARTIES | Study Project  | 2021 - 2022
I analyzed the recent trends in centralized autocratic party formation using data from the 2021 Russian elections. You can find the paper on this analysis in the Russian Politics journal, available here.
COMPARATIVE ELECTORAL STUDIES | Study Project  | 2019 - 2020
I prepared and analysed electoral data on Switzerland and Ireland with R.F. Turovsky. Electoral ballots are published on the site of the Laboratory for Regional Research , available here.

title: CV
text:
Experience
Business Analyst | Data Analytics Department | Dec 2024 - Ongoing | BartsParts B.V.
I lead the design and rollout of data-driven solutions supporting key business objectives in the e-commerce sector. My work centers on transforming complex data flows into dashboards and actionable insights.


Designed and implemented scalable data pipelines using Microsoft Fabric and Azure, integrating raw data from sales, logistics, customer support, and IT networks.


Built and deployed near-real-time Power BI dashboards tailored for Sales, Supply Chain, and Management teams, boosting data visibility and decision speed.


Identified, analyzed, and resolved critical data gaps to improve data quality and reporting accuracy across the organization.


Collaborated cross-functionally to automate data workflows and embed analytics in daily operations, delivering measurable efficiency improvements.





Junior Business Analyst | Data Analytics Department | June 2024 - Dec 2024 | BartsParts B.V.
I supported the unification of company data infrastructure and laid the groundwork for business analytics initiatives. My main responsibilities included connecting diverse data sources, preprocessing datasets, and developing custom visualizations.


Connected and consolidated data from multiple systems using SQL, SparkR, and PySpark preparing data for unified analysis.


Created custom data visualizations in R to address specific business needs and improve reporting clarity.


Collaborated with analysts and department leaders to understand reporting requirements and deliver timely, actionable insights.





Research & Teaching Assistant | Department of Methodology and Statistics | Aug 2023 - June 2024 | Utrecht University


Explored packages for Bayesian exploratory factor analysis (EFA) currently available in R and prepared a framework for a simulation study.


Assisted students to understand foundations of survey-based research & master R usage for survey data analysis.





Research Assistant | Department of Politics and Governance | Feb 2022 - Sept 2022 | Higher School of Economics


Integrated, cleaned, and managed multiple large datasets using R and Python to support quantitative research on COVID-19’s impact.


Contributed to data preparation, literature review, and the quantitative analysis of policy outcomes.


Applied statistical analysis to identify patterns and prepared reports for a cross-disciplinary research team.





Trainee Researcher | Ronald F. Inglehart Laboratory for Comparative Social Research | Feb 2021 - Feb 2022 | Higher School of Economics


Sourced, cleaned, and managed complex quantitative datasets for large-scale comparative studies, ensuring data quality and consistency.


Performed statistical analysis and built structural equation models (SEM) in R to validate research hypotheses and support data-driven recommendations.





Junior Analyst | Holding “Minchenko Consulting” | Jul 2020 - Feb 2022


Parsed and mined large volumes of data from social and traditional media platforms & search engines to extract trends in public representation.


Transformed unstructured text data into clear metrics and developed typologies using both qualitative and quantitative methods.


Co-authored and published a research paper based on this project in a Q1-ranked academic journal.









Teaching Assistant | Higher School of Economics | Oct 2020 - Jun 2021


Assisted first and second-year students with R, LaTeX, and probability theory.


Reviewed assignments and provided individual consultations to support course objectives in mathematics and politics.

title: CV
text:
Education
UTRECHT UNIVERSITY, UTRECHT | MSc in Methodology and Statistics for the Behavioural, Biomedical and Social Sciences | Track: Applied Data Science | 2022-2024
• Focused on machine learning, NLP, clustering, and survey data analysis. Thesis examined error sources in survey data linked to donated digital trace data, developing methods to reduce bias from selective participation.
HIGHER SCHOOL OF ECONOMICS, MOSCOW | BSc in Political Science | Track: Political Analysis | 2018-2022
• Graduated with honors (GPA: 8.9). Specialized in quantitative methods, including multilevel modeling, time-series analysis, and structural equation modeling.
VCIOM SOCIOLOGIC SCHOOL, MOSCOW | Winter School | Track: Policy and Market Analysis | 2022
• Focused on advanced survey design and data collection methodologies, with practical applications to policy evaluation and market research.
DULWICH COLLEGE, LONDON | Summer School | Track: Global Young Leaders | 2017
• Graduated with honors (A). Engaged in interdisciplinary study of international relations, communication, and economics, developing strong analytic and leadership skills.
